arm_group.description: MasterMed, an online interactive educational program
Access to an online patient portal

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this study is to assess the effects of an interactive educational program
      delivered through a patient portal on patients' medication knowledge and medication
      adherence.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Impact of a "Serious Game" on Improving Patient's Medication Knowledge

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          1. MGH Internal Medical Associates patients

          2. are age of 18 or older,

          3. have at least two medications on their medication list that match our pre-selected
             medications,

          4. have at least three medical conditions on their problem list that match our
             pre-selected medical conditions,

          5. have at least three medications documented on their medication list, and

          6. list English as their primary language.

        Exclusion Criteria:

        -

facility.name: Massachusetts General Hospital, Internal Medicine Associates

clinical_study.official_title: The Impact of a "Serious Game" on Improving Patient's Medication Knowledge

overall_official.affiliation: Massachusetts General Hospital, Laboratory of Computer Science

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Double Blind (Subject, Investigator), Primary Purpose: Supportive Care
